message.content:
{"id": "7734", "title": "System can be shut down without savefile warnings", "description": "When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.", "OB": "The computer is shut down or rebooted without warning or giving users a chance to save their dirty files when a WSWB session is open with unsaved .txt files.", "EB": "", "SR": "To reproduce the issue: 
1. Start WSWB and create a new project. 
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it. 
3. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file. 
4. Left click on the Windows Start menu and select the 'Shut Down...' command to shut down or reboot the computer. 

Expected results: 
A warning or question message box should be displayed, giving users a chance to save their dirty files before the computer is shut down or rebooted."}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '7734', 'title': 'Bug 7734System can be shut down without savefile warnings', 'description': '', 'OB': 'Bug 7734System can be shut down without savefile warnings When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting downWindows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.Steps To Reproduce:start WSWB and create a new projectcreate a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.Notice thatthetext file is marked as a dirty fileLeft click on the Windows Start menu, select “Shut Down…” command to shutdown/reboot the computerResults:There is no warning or question message box to give users a chance to savetheir dirty model(s), the computer is shut down/rebooted immediately.OtherWindows programs (like Word, Outlook etc. ', 'EB': '', 'SR': ''}
